Giovanni Vincenzo "Nino" Carlini (I2006) [Male] b. 29 Jul 1932 Carovilli, Isernia, Italy - d. 9 May 2011 Rancho Santa Margarita, CA

Immigration: : 17 May 1955

Info from Nino Carlini Oct 2004.

1955 17 May - arrival at New York on the Andrea Doria, going to 1180 Woodlawn Ave, Akron, OH

Giovannino Vincenzino "Nino" Carlini

Giovannino ``Nino' Vincenzino Carlini, born 29 July 1932 in Carovilli, Italy, entered eternal life 9 May 2011 in Rancho Santa Margarita, Calif.

Nino died in the home of his daughter, Marisa, having been attended by his children, sisters, sisters- in-law, brother-in-law and other family to provide comfort and solice in his final days.

He was predeceased by his wife, Rosalie Anna Gumpl-Carlini on 6 August, 2010. He is survived by his children, Giuliano (Susan), Marisa and Marcella (Jim); grandchildren, Nicholas, Marcus, Mia, Matteo and Nico; sisters, Lina (Paolo), Elsa (Bruno) and Anna (Bill); sisters-in-law, Joanne and Concetta; near a score of nieces and nephews; and a multitude of their children.

Nino came to the United States in 1955, became a U.S. Citizen but remained 100% Italian. He loved Italy and all things Italian! He would return to Italy as often as possible. He served in the armed forces of both Italy and the United States. He learned the art of tailoring in Carovilli and brought his craft to America. He worked for Yeagers in Akron, then Silverwoods in California, and eventually became head of tailoring for the western United States for Hart, Schaffner and Marx. He appreciated fine clothes his entire life and in all things appreciated when they were not only done, but done well and with elegance. Nino loved to be with family and friends, whether just one or two, or a large party. He loved to be with them eating and drinking, singing and playing the guitar, playing scopa or canasta, or just sitting and talking.

Published in Akron Beacon Journal on May 22, 2011

Change: 3 Oct 2016

Back to Main Page

Enrico "Henry" Carlini (I2008) [Male] b. 28 Jul 1938 Carovilli, Isernia, Italy - d. 4 Nov 2004 San Pedro, CA

Immigration: : 26 May 1956

Info from Nino Carlini Oct 2004.

Info from Rosalie Gumpl 11-5-04.

66y at death.

1956 arrival at New York on the Cristoforo Columbo, going to 839 1/2 North Main St, Akron, OH.

Carlini, Henry

Born July 28, 1938 in Caroville, Italy to Eliso Carlini and Guiseppina Falasca passed away peacefully November 4, 2004 in San Pedro, California. He is survived by his beloved wife Concetta; his loving family; sons Bruno (Michelle) and Maurizio; daughter Elisa (Flavio) Soria; grandchildren Antony, Katy and Angelo and three sisters and one brother. Visitation 4-8:00 pm with Rosary at 7:00 pm Holy Cross Mortuary Chapel. Funeral Mass 11:30 am Tuesday November 9th, Risen Christ Chapel, Holy Cross Mausoleum. Committal to follow. Holy Cross Mortuary Directors (310)836-5500.

Published in the Los Angeles Times on 11/7/2004.

Change: 3 Oct 2016

Back to Main Page

Rosalie Anna Gumpl (I2009) [Female] b. 13 Jan 1936 Copley, OH - d. 6 Aug 2010 Mission Viejo, Orange, CA

Info from Rosalie Gumpl 11-5-04

Social Security Death Index

Name: Rosalie Anna Carlini

SSN: 275-32-1456

Last Residence: 92692 Mission Viejo, Orange, California

Born: 13 Jan 1936

Died: 6 Aug 2010

State (Year) SSN issued: Ohio (1952-1953)

Published in Akron Beacon Journal on August 15, 2010

http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/ohio/obituary.aspx?n=rosalie-anna-carlini-gumpl&pid=144680064

Rosalie Anna Carlini (Gumpl), born 13 January 1936 in Copley Township, Ohio, died 6 August 2010 in Mission Viejo, California, at age 74.

Born of Otelia and Joseph Gumpl, her brothers were George and Joseph. She grew up on a farm and kept her connection to the land, always keeping a garden. She graduated in 1956 as a Registered Nurse from the Saint Thomas Nursing School. She remained a nurse her whole life, even after retiring from practice, always being ready to help anyone in need. Wed to John V. ``Nino' Carlini in 1958, she bore children, Giuliano (1960), Marisa (1961) and Marcella (1965) with grandchildren Nicholas (1991), Marcus (1992), Mia (2003), Matteo (2003), Nico (2005).

She moved to California in 1961, but fondly recalled her birthplace always.

She had a kind, gentle, generous spirit. She accepted and loved all who came into her life and was in turn loved by them all. She will be missed.

Change: 3 Oct 2016

U.S. Public Records Index, Volume 1

Name: Cecelia F Gatti

Birth Date: 6 Feb 1918

Address: 1224 11th St, Rock Springs, WY, 82901-5430 (1993)

http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=76553196

Published 20 Sep 2001 in The Green River Star -

Cecelia Frances Gatti, 83, of Rock Springs, died on Sept. 11 at her home following a lengthy illness.

Posted: Thursday, September 20, 2001 12:00 am

She was born Feb. 6, 1918 in Rock Springs, the daughter of the late John and Agnes Kochis Korfanta.

She was a lifelong resident of Rock Springs.

She attended schools in Rock Springs and was a graduate of the Rock Springs High School with the class of 1935.

She married Fred Gatti Sr. in Manila in 1936 and he preceded her in death in 1968.

She was a retired receptionist, having worked for Dr. Frank Bertoncelj for 13 years. She was also snack bar manager for school lunches.

She was a member of the Saints Cyril and Methodius Catholic Church, Council of Catholic Women, St. Monica's Sodality, Catholic Golden Age, Italian Trentini Club, Italian Singers and active in the Sweetwater County Democratic Party.

Survivors include one son and daughter-in-law, Fred and Shelby Jean Gatti; one daughter and son-in-law, Jene and Darrel Hubbard, of San Diego, Calif., one brother Albert "Sonny" Korfanta of Pinedale; three grandchildren, eight great-grandchildren, several brother-in-laws, sister-in-laws, cousins, nieces and nephews.

In addition to her husband and parents, she was preceded in death by five brothers; John who died in infancy, John Jr., Joe, Frank, and George; three sisters, Mary Conzatti, Katherine Auld and Anne Zueck; and one grandson, Scott Christie.

A Mass of Christian Burial was conducted Tuesday at the St. Cyril and Methodius Catholic Church. Father John Savio officiated.

Interment was in the St. Joseph's Section of the Rock Springs Municipal Cemetery.

Change: 3 Oct 2016

Back to Main Page

Results for Groom/Bride Search

Guestbook entry by great-granddaughter, Michele Kastanes, June 2020: "Antonetta "Tonita" La Bate of Ely, NV is my great grandmother. My grandmother is Violet Marie Piccinini (daughter of Tonita and Dominic Piccinini)."

Photo sent to me by Michele Kastanes, July 2020: "I did run across a picture of Tonita LaBate and Dominick Piccinini on their wedding day. June 11, 1923 in Ely, Nevada. She was 14 years old ... yikes!"

1911 EI arrival, , going to brother Giuseppe, in Rochester, NY. Born Paganica.
